newsitem.title: USA: Ahmanson sees Great Western-Washington deal slowed.
newsitem.headline: Ahmanson sees Great Western-Washington deal slowed.

text.p: H.F. Ahmanson and Co on Monday said it believed Great Western Financial Corp and Washington Mutual Inc were facing regulatory issues that could slow down their proposed transaction.
Ahmanson said the two companies should disclose to shareholders issues relating to Washington Mutual's ability to qualify as a unitary thrift holding company.
"There's no multiple holding company problem in the Washington Mutual transaction," said an attorney for Great Western. "Basically, this is a non-issue," he said.

On March 6, Great Western agreed to a stock-swap merger with Washington Mutual in an effort to thwart a hostile takeover bid by Ahmanson, the Irwindale, California-based parent of Home Savings of America.
